Class ShipCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.model.shipcard.ShipCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlienUnit, Battery, Cannon, Engine, HousingUnit, Shield, Storage, StructuralModule
public abstract class ShipCard extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an abstract ShipCard that defines the structure of a ship's component

Each ShipCard has connectors on its four sides and can have different orientations

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ShipCard

      public ShipCard(String id, ShipCard.Connector topConnector, ShipCard.Connector rightConnector, ShipCard.Connector bottomConnector, ShipCard.Connector leftConnector)
      Constructs a ShipCard with specified connectors on each side. The default orientation is 0 degrees, it is initially covered and not scrapped
      Parameters:
      topConnector - The connector on the top side
      rightConnector - The connector on the right side
      bottomConnector - The connector on the bottom side
      leftConnector - The connector on the left side

      public String getId()
      Returns:
      a String containing the id of the card

    • getTopConnector

      public ShipCard.Connector getTopConnector()
      Retrieves the connector on the top side, adjusted according to the current orientation
      Returns:
      The connector currently positioned at the top of the ShipCard

    • isCovered

      public boolean isCovered()
      Returns:
      True if the ShipCard is covered, false otherwise

      public void discover()
      Sets ShipCard's covered attribute to true

    • isIllegal

      public boolean isIllegal()
      Returns:
      True if the ShipCard is breaking some rules (with its position, connections, orientation ecc...), false otherwise

    • setIllegal

      public void setIllegal(boolean illegal)
      Sets whether the ShipCard is breaking some rules (with its position, connections, orientation ecc...)
      Parameters:
      illegal - True to mark the ShipCard as illegal, false otherwise

    • isVisited

      public boolean isVisited()
      Returns:
      True if the ShipCard was already visited by the recursive algorithm that verifies ship's integrity, false otherwise

    • setVisited

      public void setVisited(boolean visited)
      Sets whether the ShipCard is visited by the recursive algorithm that verifies ship's integrity
      Parameters:
      visited - True to mark the ShipCard as visited, false otherwise

    • isScrap

      public boolean isScrap()
      Returns:
      True if the ShipCard is scrapped, false otherwise

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Sets ShipCard's scrap attribute to true

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this ShipCard to another object for equality

      Two ShipCards are considered equal if they have the same ID, orientation, connectors, and state attributes (only scrap and covered)

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to compare with this ShipCard
      Returns:
      true if the given object is a ShipCard with the same attributes, false otherwise

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code consistent with equals(Object).

      The hash is computed from the card’s ID, connectors, orientation, and relevant state attributes (scrap and covered), ensuring structural equality is preserved in collections.

      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      the hash code of this ShipCard

    • place

      public abstract void place(ShipBoard shipBoard, int x, int y)
      Places this ShipCard on the given ShipBoard at the specified coordinates.

      Each subclass should define how it registers itself to the board’s internal data structures.

      Parameters:
      shipBoard - the ship board where this card is to be placed
      x - the x-coordinate on the board
      y - the y-coordinate on the board

    • unPlace

      public abstract void unPlace(ShipBoard shipBoard)
      Removes this ShipCard from the given ShipBoard.

      Subclasses must implement the deregistration logic, ensuring the board state remains consistent.

      Parameters:
      shipBoard - the ship board from which this card is to be removed

    • print

      public abstract void print(ShipCardCLI shipCardCLI, int i, boolean selected)
      Renders this ShipCard using the command-line interface.

      The appearance may vary depending on the card type, orientation, and selection state.

      Parameters:
      shipCardCLI - the CLI rendering utility
      i - the row index for layout purposes
      selected - true if this card is currently selected by the player; false otherwise
